thread.title: Preston vs Arsenal team news: Lucas Perez fit to start for Gunners, while Danny Welbeck returns from injury and makes the bench

author: gboulton
title: Preston vs Arsenal team news: Lucas Perez fit to start for Gunners, while Danny Welbeck returns from injury and makes the bench
text:
EFL Team News Preston vs Arsenal team news: Lucas Perez fit to start for Gunners, while Danny Welbeck returns from injury and makes the bench 
All the information you need ahead of the FA Cup clash at Deepdale By George Boulton Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LUCAS PEREZ has shaken off injury to take his place in the Arsenal team for tonight’s FA Cup third round clash against Preston. 
Olivier Giroud starts up front for the Gunners and will captain the side, while there is a rare first-team appearance for Ainsley Maitland-Niles at right-back. Danny Welbeck makes his return from injury but starts on the bench. Here it is – our team for #PNEvAFC pic.twitter.com/wA2BeBGnPa 
— Arsenal FC (@Arsenal) January 7, 2017 #pnefc starting Xl v Arsenal: Maxwell, Vermijl, Clarke, Huntington, Cunningham, Gallagher, Pearson, Johnson, McGeady, Robinson and Hugill. pic.twitter.com/G59i0IObyt 
GET 2/1 ON MAN UNITED, ARSENAL, LIVERPOOL AND SPURS ALL TO WIN THIS WEEKEND 
Gabriel makes his 50th appearance under Arsene Wenger. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Preston and Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Preston have named new signing Daryl Horgan on the bench as Simon Grayson plots the downfall of one of the competition’s big guns. He has joined from Irish champions Dundalk City. Getty Images 3 Lucas Perez has surprisingly made the line-up for Arsenal tonight after recovering from injury 
After being knocked out of the EFL Cup at the quarter-final stage by Southampton, Arsene Wenger will be determined to progress to the next round. 
Who is playing for Preston in the FA Cup? 
Line-up: Maxwell, Vermijl, Clarke, Huntington, Cunningham, Gallagher, Pearson, Johnson, McGeady, Robinson, Hugill. 
Who is playing for Arsenal in the FA Cup? 
Line-up: Ospina, Maitland-Niles, Mustafi, Gabriel, Monreal, Xhaka, Ramsey, Ox, Iwobi, Lucas, Giroud. Richard Pelham 3 Olivier Giroud produced an incredible scorpion kick for Arsenal against Crystal Palace 
Preston are currently 11th in the Championship but have only won once at home in their last six matches, meaning it will be a tough ask to overcome the Gunners. 
What is the latest Preston team news? 
John Welsh misses out for North End as he continues to recover from a calf injury. New signing Daryl Horgan makes the bench. 
Who is definitely out for Preston? 
Jermaine Beckford is still serving his four match ban whilst Calum Woods remains a long term doubt. 
What is the latest Arsenal team news? 
Arsenal’s attacker Lucas Perez has recovered from a knock and makes the team. But Olivier Giroud will occupy the central striking berth. 
Young prospect Ainsley Maitland-Niles will start the game at right-back. 
Who is definitely out for Arsenal: 
Campbell, Cazorla, Debuchy, Elneny, Mertesacker, Sanogo, Szczesny. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog Simon Grayson will hope Preston can turn around their home form
